question.text: Which of the following statements regarding digestive glands is correct?

options.text: Saliva is produced mainly by three glands in the human body.
The liver is situated in the abdominal cavity, just lateral to the diaphragm.
The common hepato-pancreatic duct is guarded by the sphincter of Oddi.
The exocrine portion of the pancreas secretes an acidic pancreatic juice.

solution.text: Saliva is produced by three pairs of glands, i.e., parotid, sub-mandibular and sublingual glands. The liver is situated in the abdominal cavity just above the diaphragm. The exocrine portion of the pancreas secretes pancreatic juice, which is alkaline in nature.
